chargeHist.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy Jamar Allen

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremy Jamar Allen appeared by video.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Jeremy Jamar Allen.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer G. Gregory. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.
court verbally ordered non violent contact with the various individuals
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no Violent contact with:  BA, MA, YA and GA.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for LEVEL 4 Supervision. 
Not to use or possess any dangerous weapons including No ignitable material.

Initial Appearance conducted: 
Defendant received copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   
Court advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  
Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). 
Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE. Preliminary Hearing scheduled October 11, 2022 at 8:30am.

Defendant Jeremy Jamar Allen appeared by video, in custody.  
Attorney Sylvan Jaspen for Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Jeremy Jamar Allen.  
Attorney William R. F. Ackell appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for competency review hearing. Court reviews doctor's report with the parties.  
State, defense counsel and defendant are not challenging the findings of the doctor's report.
Court  adopts the professional opinion of the examiner:
Court finds the defendant does not lack substantial capacity to understand the proceedings or aid in his defense. 
Court finds defendant competent and reinstates the proceedings.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court is in receipt of DHS email requesting this case be scheduled within 14 days.
Parties confirmed new scheduling date via email. Review hearing scheduled October 3, 2022 at 8:30am.

Defendant Jeremy Jamar Allen in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Jeremy Jamar Allen in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for Doctor's Report Return. Parties viewed Competency Report from Dr. Deborah L. Collins, dated July 6, 2022. Parties do not contest report. Defense requested a review hearing. Defendant stayed mute. Court orders Defendant transferred to DHS forthwith for treatment and counseling. Case adjourned in Branch 45.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Review hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE.

Defendant Jeremy Jamar Allen in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Jeremy Jamar Allen in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeremy Jamar Allen appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
